DataElement.preferredName: Neurological And/Or Neurodevelopmental Disorder Disease or Disorder Present Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the neurologic and/or neurodevelopmental disorder.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Neurological Deficit or Dysfunction And/Or Neurodevelopmental Disorder Disease or Disorder Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A finding of pathologic function within the central or peripheral nervous system, secondary to developmental abnormalities, infections, neurologic damage, or tumors._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._A childhood disorder that has a neurological basis and manifests as a developmental disability._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Neurological Deficit or Dysfunction And/Or Neurodevelopmental Disorder Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A finding of pathologic function within the central or peripheral nervous system, secondary to developmental abnormalities, infections, neurologic damage, or tumors.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:A childhood disorder that has a neurological basis and manifests as a developmental disability.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: A finding of pathologic function within the central or peripheral nervous system, secondary to developmental abnormalities, infections, neurologic damage, or tumors.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
A childhood disorder that has a neurological basis and manifests as a developmental disability.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
